sub_title: Senior Scientist I at Charles River Laboratories

profile_positions.description:
Managing client-based projects focusing on early-stage discovery using cell-based assays to identify novel targets for drug development of (rare) diseases. Combination of project management (client interaction, financial analysis, planning, and managing project team), lab-based execution of experiments (assay development, screening and target validation), data analysis, reporting, and laboratory notebook writing. Supervision/support of junior staff within project teams. Managing 2-3 projects simultaneously.

Techniques:
Virus production, virus purification, human embryonic stem cell culture, siRNA transfection, HTRF, qPCR, MSD, Western blot, High-content imaging and quantification, neuronal differentiation, transduction, PBMC isolation, T-cell based assays, Cell-Titer Glo, Real-Time Glo, immunocytochemistry staining, compound exposure, primary cell culture, suspension cell culture, FMT, use of various robotics and (semi) automated liquid handlers. Automated data analysis using Activity Base and Vortex.

Lean Six Sigma GreenBelt certification - ongoing

Part of Works Council from March 2023 onward
- Drafting agendas and minutes for meetings
- Processing endorsement and advice requests

Member of event planning committee from February 2019 onward:
- Coming up with, planning and executing activities for employees

Coordinator of buddy system from August 2019 onward:
- Matching new starters with buddies to ensure warm welcome and streamline on-boarding process
- Originated buddy system and drafted guide lines buddies share with new starters regarding procedures, general know-how, social activities, etc.

profile_positions.title: Associate Scientist

company.name: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson

profile_positions.company: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson
profile_positions.description:
Responsible for bridging study between two metabolite analysers. Writing study plans, performing experimental work, analysing and documenting data in study report. 
Sampling of bioreactors to monitor metabolite concentrations, cell count, pH, and osmolality during cell and virus production runs.
Shaker flask experiments for process characterization.
Continuous improvement, lean, 5S.

Techniques: ViCell cell counts, NOVA Bioprofile 400 metabolite analysis, CuBiAn metabolite analysis, bioreactor sampling, shaker flask medium refreshment, adenovirus sample preparation, aseptic techniques.
profile_positions.title: Associate scientist USP

profile_positions.description:
Determination of haemagglutinin (HA) content of influenza vaccine samples using the single radial diffusion (SRD) test.
Involvement in continuous improvement projects.
Working under GMP/GDP conditions.
Result recording in SAP.
profile_positions.title: Quality control technician

company.name: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson

profile_positions.company: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson
profile_positions.description:
Internship at the department Viral Vaccines, Vector Generation. Grade: 8.0.
Examination of the effect of different parameters on the ratio between viral particles and infectious units of type D adenovirus. 
Measurement of transgene expression after determination of type D adenovirus infectious units with TCID50 assay.
	
Techniques: TCID50 assay, mammalian cell culture, luciferase assay.
profile_positions.title: Intern
